Specific Details: The Chamber encourages a stronger mechanism be put in place to support local businesses - this could be breaking down larger scale projects into sectors within that project. This would allow more local businesses be in a position to  tender for  local work and therefore would support local employment & the economy and in turn local rate payers

Specific Details: Serious consideration be given to the collection (or non-collection) of rates by Waterford Council particularly in relation to the Vacant Site Levy (2017) which came into effect in Jan 2018 and to the Commercial Unit Vacancy Rate.
DPOs Lobbied: Damien Geoghegan|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::Pat Nugent|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::Tom Cronin|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::Conor D. McGuinness|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::Thomas Phelan|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::Seamus O'Donnell|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::Declan Doocey|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::James Tobin|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council::John Pratt|Councillor|Waterford City and County Council
Subject Matter: Serious consideration be given to the collection (or non-collection) of rates by Waterford Council particularly in relation to the Vacant Site Levy (2017) which came into effect in Jan 2018 and to the Commercial Unit Vacancy Rate.
Intended Results: There are many properties that are vacant for years despite demand for commercial premises. The Dungarvan & West Waterford Chamber wish to see vibrant urban centres where occupancy is priority and vacancy is discouraged. The D&WW Chamber believes that collection of rates on the vacant site levy and a rate on long term commercial vacancy would generate the additional revenue required by the Waterford Council for the inclusions in the 2022 budget
